intro: Perezia inermis, commonly known as the slender perezia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Perezia inermis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
